author: {'steamid': '76561197989834951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1694050712}
review:
English:

The Corporate Machine is an old strategy and management game that, despite not having modern graphics or sounds, has a lot to offer for those who want to learn about business management. The game itself is simple, it sins a little for not having tutorials or tips "in game", making you resort to the manual to understand the mechanics in a deeper way. However, after this understanding, it is clear that it contains the basic dynamics of the manufacturing chain, research, financial and team management that every business contains. Similar to some other Business Management titles like Capitalism 1 and 2 it manages to entertain and at the same time teach about Business Management. I recommend.

Brazilian Portuguese (Português):

The Corporate Machine é um jogo antigo de estratégia e gerenciamento que apesar de não ter gráficos ou sons modernos tem bastante a oferecer para quem quer aprender sobre gerenciamento de negócios. O jogo em sí é simples, ele peca um pouco por não ter tutoriais ou dicas "in game", fazendo com que se recorra ao manual para entender a mecânica de forma mais profunda. Todavia depois deste entendimento percebe-se que ele contem as dinâmicas básicas de cadeia de manufatura, pesquisa, gerenciamento financeiro e de equipe que todo negócio contém. Semelhante a alguns outros títulos de Gerenciamento de Negócios como Capitalism 1 e 2 ele consegue entreter e ao mesmo tempo ensinar sobre Administração de negócios. Recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198975056592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1707953318}
review: After all these years The Corporate Machine still holds up as being one of the best business RTS game. Here is hoping for a remaster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026912052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1764, 'last_played': 1643123497}
review: This game is worth playing if you are into corporate style games.  It has multiple flaws, even as it fixed a few issues from the original "Entrepreneur" game.  In my opinion the original has more longevity, but is sadly not available anymore due to a lawsuit.  If you can't find the original, this is fine, just don't focus too hard on research as the technilogy tree system won't last very long before there is nothing left to do to improve your product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1708673121}
review:
The Corporate Machine is a badly updated version of the game of the same name from 2001, it's a global strategy/simulation game.  Run a global corporation and take over the world!

The game has aged very badly and doesn't display properly, looks back, and plays worse.  It's very clunky.   Stardock has been extra greedy on this one and are charging a whopping $14.50 for a nostalgia trip, but you'll only find disappointment here.   Can't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007228378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1558625111}
review:
This game is in dire need of "help tools" or a tutorial, I mean there were absolutely no introduction to how this game works, you are just thrown into the deep end while you can hope you know how to swim. 

I won't even bother with a pro/con list, because I have not played the game long enough to make one, and the reason for that is, I totally did not get any help as to how the game worked, where i found what, and how I got started producing my computers.

I don't mind the outdated graphics, they are actually considered "in" by some people. Since I am not a natural to these kind of RTS/simulation games, I really needed a tutorial or help tools to explain the screen, since there was none of that, I gave up trying to play this game, and that is also the reason why I cannot recommend this game. Perhaps those used to playing such games will got more out of it, but if you are someone like me, you are totally lost and will not get anything out of the game unless you count the dissapointment over having spent money on getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013132245', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1607277244}
review:
The basic gameplay involves reaching revenue targets to attract new salespeople, who are used to dominate new regions.  Eventually competing companies try to acquire your regions and you theirs, and research plays a factor in product superiority.  I like the tension created by reallocating salespeople to take over areas.  Then there are cards to play which aren't immediately accessible until requisite resources from certain regions are built up.

I bought this on sale for about $5.  No disappointment here!  Even without having read the manual, there are gameplay elements that are enjoyable and the basic premise has a great hook.  I can see continuing to play this for a while.  Yes of course the game could use improved graphics - but the gameplay is enjoyable and has a nice level of tension.  Recommended, though because the graphics are such crap and you might have some doubts whether the game is a keeper, wait for the sale price.  If you like economic sims already, it might be worth full price and hope for a refund if you don't get hooked within the first hour of playing.

- Game has bugs.  For example when winning an NDA lawsuit, getting a settlement larger than I think any company could have available  (2 orders of magnitude over).  Either this is a bug or the AI cheats very badly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117326886', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1526717236}
review:
A real time strategy game that is not about destroying your opponents through war and carnage. But rather wolrd domination by getting everyone to use your products instead of your competitors. 

The game gives you many tools to get your product to be desired more than your opponents in a region. targeted marketing campaigns that highlight desired traits of your product over your opponent. Shady politics and smear campaigns to reduc public opinion of your opponents in a region. You will move your executives around the map to nab resources that you can use special ability cards with various effects. on top of all that youll be building new facotry and research staions all across the world to try to keep up with your competiors in terms of tech and production. 

Overall id say this is a game that has some strategic depth that any fan of managent type rts games can enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001679105', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 560, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1525687630}
review:
C’est un jeu de 2001 créer dans les années 90, donc, il ne faut pas trop en demander.
Chose importante, il faut absolument lire le manuel pour comprendre comment bien jouer, un Walkthrough est même intégrer pour apprendre tout en détail.

Trop épuré, trop vide, le jeu se fini quand vous avez atteins 55% des parts de marché.

Je ne sais pas à quoi ressemblait Stardock à l’époque, mais d’autres jeux plus vieux sont largement mieux réalisés.

Si lire 30 pages d’un manuel en Anglais ne vous déplaît pas, que vous aimez les jeux old-school et que vous cherchez un petit jeu sympa, c’est pour vous, mais si une seule chose vous déplaît dedans cette liste, passez votre chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061160033', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1525004429}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007215043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1523595825}
review: Отличная динамичная олдскульная экономическая стратежка. Выбираем тип производства (компы, машины, самолеты). Ставим заводик, начинаем производить. Исследуем регионы, спрос на нашу продукцию увеличивается. Постепенно появляются конкуренты. Начинаем выделяться, строим исследовательский центр, маркетинг, ублажаем рабочих, рассылаем коммивояджеров по регионам, дабы те отхапали долю рынка далее совершенствуем продукцию и апгрейдим производственные мощности. Стоит оно того? Однозначно да! Но игрушка старая уже, поэтому берите на распродаже. Любителям экономических симов с базовым знанием английского вполне зайдет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275497874', 'num_games_owned': 929, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1508009548}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993434587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1502401721}
review: Picked this up in some bundle.  It crashed, and I'd seen enough not to really want to re-open it.  Might spark some nostalgia for someone that played it back when it released, but not really captivating to me as a newcomer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995405007', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1509989013}
review:
I've read that some people have issues getting this to run on Windows 10, but I got zero issues.

Using Windows 10 Pro x64 it started without problems right out of the box after downloading, and without any glitches or issues I played my first game in ages (the last time I played this game it was on a Pentium II most likely).

Its just as good as I remember it, and you still have to build a competitive business in a new market from the ground up.

The research that is required to stay on the edge, while investigating new regions and building factories is what makes this game hard to ballance and master. It takes time and experience to get to a sweetspot in all this. Luckily the user interface has all the tools to provide you with the information you need.

After all these years this game is still a lot of fun, and if you don't mind the highly outdated graphics, and are lucky enough that it just runs on your machine - you're in for a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093082664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1508871379}
review:
Je l'ai eu dans un bundle; heureusement.
N'allez pas gâcher votre argent sur ce jeu. Il est bon si vraiment vous vous emmerdez, et encore.
De toute évidence, on y va pas pour les graphismes. C'est un jeux vendu comme un jeu d'économie. LOL. Vous vendez 1 unique objet tout le long du jeux, que vous pouvez faire évoluer par des recherches, et vous êtes en concurrence avec d'autres firmes - qui, selon toute évidence, vendent le même truc. 
Pour vendre plus, vous pouvez améliorer l'objet avec des technos, ou faire une campagne de pub. Chacune de ces deux options nécessite la construction d'un bâtiment. L'évolution desdits bâtiments coûte de plus en plus cher. Jusque là, ça semble "logique", quoi que simplet. Mais le plus beau, c'est que si vous faites rien, la valeur de votre machin va quand même évoluer. 
Oh, vous pouvez aussi descendre vos concurrents (en terme de pub, j'entends)
Donc, niveau économique, c'est quand même carrément limité (le jeu lui-même se vante de faire simple). C'est un peu comme cliquer sur un cookie, sans le cookie. 

Il y a plein de petits onglets, de graphiques, d'infos....qui manquent de sens. Rien, strictement rien n'est expliqué (sauf l'objectif: atteindre 55% de part de marché pour gagner. Bon, perso, à un moment du jeu cet objectif est passé à 60%, je sais pas pourquoi).  Comme lesdits graphiques/infos n'ont pas de nom, juste une image, à vous de les parcourir en devinant leur signification; certains sont plutôt clairs, d'autres nécessite d'avant dans le jeux pour comprendre enfin leur utilité. Y'en a j'ai pas trouvé. Mais bon, au bout de deux heures, le jeu a planté tout seul sans raison, alors....j'en ai profité pour le désinstaller. 

Passez votre chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162338402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1526805100}
review: Ich kann das Spiel nicht empfehlen. Der 3. Absturz in einer Stunde macht es unspielbar und 10 Euro halte ich für weit übertrieben. 0,50 Euro wäre angemessen als symbolische Geste falls es funktioniert. Der Inhalt ist nicht einmal vollständig, da gab es 2001 bereits Ergänzungen die hier nicht dabei sind. Zum Spielprinzip und zur Grafik selbst kann ich nur sagen, dass es heute jedenfalls unterirdisch ist und ich selbst 2001 keine 10 Euro dafür ausgegeben hätte, da gab es auch damals wesentlich bessere Alternativen. Warum man das heute verkauft.....

author: {'steamid': '76561197972448343', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1507596270}
review: Buggy, pixelly and not something I'd do for fun. I got it from a humble bundle but I wouldn't buy it seperately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022043009', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1507836743}
review:
Decent for a game that i had got from the bundle. Be sure you play in compatability mode as always with these kind of games. 

Obviously it takes some trail and error but hey, that was how it was in the early 2000. Simcity 2k didn't come with an ingame tutorial, nope you had a 137 pages booklet to go trough. Fortunatly we have the power of let's play now at hand so we can take a peek at that. Wouldn't advice to buy it for the 10 euro it costs in store tough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028562664', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1507828724}
review: What even is this game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198040934507', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1693073419}
review:
This game is amazing, and it surprisingly has aged fairly well. I never encountered any bugs during my gameplay, but the gameplay itself can be pretty tricky to learn (you really just have to teach yourself). I completed a game on easy mode with a few struggles, but it looks like there's still more to the game that I haven't discovered yet (nor am I inclined to read the terrible manual to find out). This game isn't for everyone, but if you can get past its issues, you will definitely have a good time.

Anyways, I did look at this game earlier in the year and decided it wasn't worth 10$, but after getting it as a bonus game in the humble bundle, I'm blown away by how much fun I had playing it. If I had to rebuy this game, I would shell out 10$ on it in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001253264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1507665632}
review:
I got this off of a Humble Bundle. I can't imagine someone actually buying this at full price (9.99 atm).

It's a fun game once you learn what everything means. The UI has no rollover text so it doesn't really explain things fully.
It looks dated, even for a game that supposedly came out in 2001 (it is on par with the original Civilization, if you guys were fortunate enough to play that). And no, there is no play-in-window mode. 

You could get used to the quirks, but the real problem is the amount of crashing and weird glitches. Most cause you to have to do a full restart on your computer (save often!). Even alt-tabbing can cause it to lock up the system. FYI, Windows 7. 

If you get it cheap enough, sure. Beware the lock-ups. 
Full price? Pffffftttt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998361851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1507654823}
review:
If you get over the graphics, of which you get use to within a few minutes, this is a godamn GEM. I've never played it before this day in 2017 but godamn, it reminds me of why old games were so fucking amazing. So many graphs and information that modern games just lack or don't care about.

A word of caution to the young folks, there's no tutorial other than the 50 or so words in the bottom left at the start. But foranyone lost; Basically HQ's and Salesmanagers have a 1square aoe increasing market interest. Then it's up to you to either have a better product, cheaper product, or better marketing.

It's kind of ingenious because it teaches you a lot about how companies work and handle themselves.

If you have a gang of oldies get together for a LAN or over Discord/skype/etc. I'd highly recommend playing this multiplayer, the cards and sabotages make for insane fun and so that noone can trully steamroll. 

I'd even go so far as to say it'd be worth full price if you have that setup of friends (up to 9), else buy it on sale or Humblebundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052713577', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1558766300}
review:
Очень мощная глобальная бизнес-стратегия. На выбор 3 сценария, 3 вида бизнеса - самолеты, автомобили и компьютеры.
Развиваемся из простого регионального офиса, до международных корпораций. Строим головные офисы, центры дистрибьюции продукции и прочее.
Из ключевых факторов, помимо сборки самих аппаратов, не забываем про маркетинг, а также научные разработки. В идеале нужно держать баланс между всеми 3-мя пунктами.
В игре также присутствуют случайные события, которые могут помочь или наоборот навредить вам в вашем сложном бизнес пути - можно открыть технологию, популярный журнал напишет о вас статью, или же наводнением затопит ваши склады с продукцией или еще чего похлеще.
По началу все было круто, играл на Beginner и радовался увеличением своего кармана, но потом влезли конкуренты и мало того сперли технологии. Лучше сразу выжимать конкурентов в том регионе, где они засели (заниматься маркетингом, снизить цены и т.д.), а то они могут забрать часть рынка спроса на вашу продукцию. Ушли они или нет, можно понять по отсутствию их фирмы в списке активности торговли в регионе.
Бывает даже такое, что стоимость товара я поднял до 9000$, а у конкурента было 5600$ в одном и том же регионе, одинаковые технологии и прочее,  но покупали у меня, т.к. я в этом регионе "царствовал" несколько лет и занимался маркетингом. Грубо говоря покупатели просто ко мне привыкли. В общем в игре все очень даже реалистично.
Еще, забавно было попытаться "изобрести" тач скрин на черно-белом мониторе с текстовыми символами )
В общем поиграть, представить себя магнатом, понервничать за падающую кривую доходов и просто расслабится - в этой игре более чем возможно. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079786794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1507169143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082030653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1506204072}
review: I got this with stardock legends pack, so it was so cheap. It works on my win 10, and I don't update it unless it asks me so it works perfectly on win10. First with the cons, the training isn't working as it shows when you press f2 ( it's been showed in help, f1) so I played a game at beginner than "difficult in pain". After few lose I managed to own the world. So there should be some ways to endure the others. Ok you will say me to use cards and lucki but cards require too much resources for a losing company. Maybe I'm telling this because MOBA games and their competitive game strategy is popular now, however, I still think there should be balance.  Also I wish to have suggestions to continue after 55% global market sharings. Or there would be other choices such as technology winnig.  And pros, if you like this kind of games you will like it. You really need to control market, demand and sellings should be balanced very well, otherwise you lose. I really liked it. I wish ppl upgraded it till now, but this gem also lost itself in the marketing :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198030895590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5182, 'last_played': 1707710984}
review:
I loved this game when it came out, and was very glad to see it re released on steam.  You play the CEO of a tech startup company and  by managing production, research, marketing, and sales you play for control of the global computer market.  It feels a little bit like Risk when you are playing it.

I have played this game hundreds of times, and there are many different ways to win.  Each time you play it different as the traits of the territories change on each map randomly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156655768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1476134375}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025376643', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1466980662}
review:
You know Risk.... One of those ancient relics called a "board game".  Well meet the basic version of that same board game... with no armies.  Just a single product.  That you sell.  Realistically, this isn't even a reflection of a real world producting team and I'm sure in its day it was great. 

But I never played it until it came onto steam yesturda, and I can say this game has had its day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153774213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1490857718}
review: I think the mechanics arent working to be honest. So I decided to build the company store then upgrade it to the company mall where it promises that I will be able to cut costs of my employees by 15% each level. However, when I proceed to do it. nothing happens. My costs still remains the same. manufacturing costs and the rest are the same. is this game broken? And when i'm playing in the normal mode it seems that even if I had the 'researcher' specialised field, i'm always being overtaken. Even though many years has passed, bugs are prominent in this game causing it to crash. When I research things as well ie.jet engine. my aircraft still looks the same as what I start off with - a propeller driven plane, not like the picture above. what a dissapointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045315620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1448570973}
review:
As a business simulator, it does very very well educationally. As a video game, its mediocre at best with so many demographics and color schemes that you'll more than likely will need glasses or go blind when you're done playing it. It has its moments where I have fun with the silly names and overall domination factor when you completely make your product a standard on just one continent let alone the whole world.

I bought this on sale @ 3.29 USD and worth its price. 9.99 USD is a bit much for the type of game you're getting. At 2001, its a good price for its time. But its well over 14+ years. I would say purchase this once it hits 4.99. 

Either way, its a solid game.

review: I used to love this game when i had it as a demo as a kid, but i really regret buying it now. The game randomly stops working after a period ingame so you play russian roulette with crashes to even be able to play it the game is a solid 7/10 the delivery though is a 2/10 definitly not worth the money in its current format

author: {'steamid': '76561198126026079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1590190909}
review:
The first thing I need to say is READ THE MANUAL! If you're like me and tend to play a casual game or two to get the hang of things it's very easy to have no idea what you are doing and lose the game. A quick skiim of the manual will give you an idea of what is what and how the game runs.
I very nearly wrote a bad review after my first game after giving up in just five minutes, I hadn't read the manual and had no clue what I was doing.

The graphics and sound options on the game are not great, basic graphics and no volume control are something of a turn-off, but you can do what I did and turn off the game's music and ignore the graphiocs quality.

Style of play.... According to the game there are three ways of playing; production, marketing and research. Nope. You either do all three or you'll have a hard time playing. All you really get top decide is which area you have that edge.
Production is the number one priority since lack of products means lack of sales, and with no sales toy have no income to improve the business.
Marketing and Research are roughly equal, the first gives you unstated bonuses in sales as it makes the product more attractive whilst the second can improve the performance/features/whatever of the product or make it cheaper and faster to produce the product, improving your profit margin.

I could go on but I'm not good at writing reviews so I'll finish with some ratings.
Playability 6/10 The game isn't particularly engrossing but is good for quick games (1-2hrs)
Functionality 5/10 The game runs easily but I have dealt with random crashes several times (Regular saving helps)
Graphics 3/10 Not great quality and most of the buttons aren't labelled so you have to work those things out.
Sound 2/10 Volume control is either Loud or Off but the quality isn't bad.

Overall score 4.5/10
I'm going to give the game a positive recommendation since it's one of those games where if you're looking for somethign quick to play it delivers the goods. It just suffers on quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013079368', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1478574517}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083254992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1466881288}
review: The Corporate Machine is actually very interesting and well-done. Although the graphics are a little outdated, this game is great. Especially in 2001, if you were making a strategy game, it HAD to be based off war. But this one is like Risk, and still, instead of using your armies to conquer the world, you use competitvley low prices and monopolies to do so. One problem I have with the game is that there is no real in-game tutorial, like modt other PC games of the time. However, there is a manual online.
